intro: Stylidium planifolium, commonly known as the flat-leaf stickseed, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its small, erect growth habit. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces clusters of small, yellowish flowers. It is often found in sandy or rocky soils in arid and semi-arid regions. Stylidium planifolium is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
